backgroundlink.recordname: reference.backgrounddata.urbanbountyhunter@D&D Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide - Player's Guide

character.bonds: I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.

text.p: Prerequisites: Strength 15 or higher
You can disable your enemies, or break them.

list.li: Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Your unarmed strikes score a critical hit on a 19-20. If they already do, increase critical hit range by 1.

Using your bonus action, you must Clearly Call a Targets limb before making the attack(s). The target must have the specified anatomy for this to have any effect. The effects last until either the end of a specified time limit or the creature heals at least 10 Hit Points.

text.p: Target Arm : It makes a Strength saving throw (DC 8+your Strength modifier+your proficiency), on a failed save they drop a held item. If both arms are disabled, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and it cannot add its Strength modifier to attack or damage rolls.

Target Leg : It makes a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8+your Strength modifier+your proficiency), on a fail their speed is reduced by half. If all legs are disabled it has a speed of 0, falls Prone, and cannot benefit from any buffs to movement speed.

Target Head : It makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 8+your Strength modifier+your proficiency), if it fails it is Stunned for 1 round. This does not effect a creature wearing a helmet or some form of head protection.

Target Torso : It makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 8+your Strength modifier+your proficiency), on a fail it has disadvantage on Strength and Constitution checks, saving throws, and attack rolls for 1 round.
You have trained hard to master unarmed combat.
Your unarmed strikes score a critical hit on a 19-20. If they already do, they score a critical hit on an 18-20. If they already do, they score a critical hit on a 17-20.

When you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike, the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). If they fail, choose one of the following effects:

list.li: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn.

text.p: Prerequisite strength or dexterity of 12 or higher.
Increase strength or dexterity by 1.
You now hit critically on a 19.
If they already do, they score a critical hit on an 18-20. If they already do, they score a critical hit on a 17-20.

You are in frequent contact with people in the segment of society that your chosen quarries move through. These people might be associated with the criminal underworld, the rough-and-tumble folk of the streets, or members of high society. This connection comes in the form of a contact in any city you visit, a person who provides information about the people and places of the local area.
Additionally, parts of your skin are covered by a thin sheen of dragon-like scales. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + Dexterity modifier.
After being trained by a dragon, the Dragonslayer learned the elemental magic of said dragon and can use it a will.
You can roll a d6 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike.

As a Dragonslayer when you choose your elemental specialization you can eat the element you are trained in and recover 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier. Also recover one spell slot. It cost one Dragonslayer Magic Point.
Your powers awaken withing you revealing the training you had with your teacher. Dragonslayer magic flows on you and small spikes of ice grow from your fingers.

Starting at 3rd level, your magic allows you to harness the elemental magic. Your access to this power is represented by a number of Dragonslayer magic points. You earn two levels per dragonslayer level. Once you use a magic point it will be unavailable until you finish a short or long rest.

Given your Dragonslayer's Magic you surround your fists in the element given to you. Add 1d6 elemental damage to your unarmed strikes. This feature will cost you 2 Dragonslayer Magic points.This lasts for a minute.
You are resistance to damaga dealt to you of your same magical element. This feature upgrades to inmunity at level 12.

Your Dragonslayer magic starts building inside you allowing to breath the element of your magic in a 15 radius cone in front of you. A target must succeed on a Dexterity save of 15 or take 12 (3d6) of your element on a failed save, or half as much on a save one. This feature will cost you 3 Dragonslayer Magic points.

Your Dragonslayer's elemental magic flows through your body allowing you to cover yourself in it. As a bonus action you may surround yourself with the element you wield for 10 minutes or until you use a bonus action to release your magic. When surrounded with your element you gain a +1 Bonus to your AC and any unarmed strike done towards you will hurt the attacker by 7 (2d6) of magic elemental damage. This feature will cost you 3 Dragonslayer Magic points.
After your training in draconic arts, at level 5 you attack twice once you choose the attack action.
After reaching level 6 your unarmored strikes count as magical.

You may unleash your element into the ground causing it to boil with power around a 5 foot safe zone. The ground in a 20-foot radius centered you becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 3d6 elemental damage for every 5 feet it travels. The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area at the time the spell is cast must make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it. This Dragonslayer Ability requires 6 Dragonslayer Magic Points and lasts for 1 minute.

character.flaws: If there's a plan, I'll forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll ignore it.
character.ideals: Honor. I don't steal from others in the trade. Redemption. There's a spark of good in everyone.

description.p: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.
This glass bottle contains a large spider suspended in amber liquid.
Upon drinking the Spider Wine, roll a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a success you are granted resistance to poison for 1 hour. On an 7 or lower, you are poisoned for 1 hour.
Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.
You regain hit points when you drink this potion.
The number of hit points depends on the potion's rarity, as shown in the Potions of Healing table. Whatever its potency, the potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

id-00006.name: Superior Potion of Healing
id-00006.nonidentified: The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

description.p: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch-or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel-takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes for 1 hour. The type of giant determines the score (see the table below). The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type. The potion of frost giant strength and the potion of stone giant strength have the same effect.

id-00011.name: Potion of Hill Giant Strength
id-00011.nonidentified: This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

description.p: This fine garment is made of black silk interwoven with faint silvery threads. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

list.li: You have resistance to poison damage.
You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.
You can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were difficult terrain.
You can use an action to cast the web spell (save DC 13).

description.p: The web created by the spell fills twice its normal area. Once used, this property of the cloak can't be used again until the next dawn.
You have resistance to one damage type while wearing this ring. The gem in the ring indicates the type, which the GM chooses or determines randomly.

This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again.
Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Placing a bag of holding inside an extra-dimensional space created by a handy haversack, portable hole, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one--way only and can't be reopened.

id-00015.name: Bag of Holding
id-00015.nonidentified: This large burlap bag is approximately 2 feet in diameter at its mouth and 4 feet deep.

description.p: While you wear this cloak, it projects an illusion that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while you are incapacitated, restrained, or otherwise unable to move.
This Keg of Beer has 10 portion for a medium creature. Upon drinking a portion the creature must make a Constitution saving throw DC 14 or increase one Stage of Drunkenness.

These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. They have 3 charges. While wearing them, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast the charm person spell (save DC 13) on a humanoid within 30 feet of you, provided that you and the target can see each other.
The lenses regain all expended charges daily at dawn.

id-00020.name: Eyes of Charming
id-00020.nonidentified: Two crystal lenses bound together with a little bit of wire.

description.p: You regain hit points when you drink this potion.
The number of hit points depends on the potion's rarity, as shown in the Potions of Healing table. Whatever its potency, the potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

id-00021.name: Greater Potion of Healing
id-00021.nonidentified: The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

description.p: This glass jar, 3 inches in diameter, contains 1d4 + 1 doses of a thick mixture that smells faintly of aloe.
The jar and its contents weigh 1/2 pound.
As an action, one dose of the ointment can be swallowed or applied to the skin. The creature that receives it regains 2d8 + 2 hit points, ceases to be poisoned, and is cured of any disease.
You regain hit points when you drink this potion.
The number of hit points depends on the potion's rarity, as shown in the Potions of Healing table. Whatever its potency, the potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

id-00023.name: Potion of Healing
id-00023.nonidentified: The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

description.p: Legend says that this feather was given as a gift from a friendly angelic creature. That creature supposedly imparted some magic into it that allows its use in creating certain products.
While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC.
In addition, if an effect moves you against your will along the ground, you can use your reaction to reduce the distance you are moved by up to 10 feet.
CR 3 Drake
You regain hit points when you drink this potion.
The number of hit points depends on the potion's rarity, as shown in the Potions of Healing table. Whatever its potency, the potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

id-00027.name: Greater Potion of Healing
id-00027.nonidentified: The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

description.p: Cold to the touch
Poisons
Has Camouflage underwater

Mithral is a light flexible metal. A mithral chain shirt or breastplate can be worn under normal clothes. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement the mithral version of the armor doesn't.
You have resistance to force damage while you wear this armor.

character.name: Vyserion "Ds Tier1"
character.personalitytraits: I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.The first thing I do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable-or where such things could be hidden.The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, your magic allows you to harness the elemental magic. Your access to this power is represented by a number of Dragonslayer magic points. You earn two levels per dragonslayer level. Once you use a magic point it will be unavailable until you finish a short or long rest.

As a Dragonslayer when you choose your elemental specialization you can eat the element you are trained in and recover 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier. Also recover one spell slot. It cost one Dragonslayer Magic Point.

Given your Dragonslayer's Magic as a bonus action you surround your fists in the element given to you. Add 1d6 elemental damage to your unarmed strikes. This feature will cost you 2 Dragonslayer Magic points.This lasts for a minute.

id-00006.label: Crippling Striker - torso; DISATK; DISCHK: strength, dexterity; DISSAV: strength, dexterity

description.p: Your Dragonslayer magic starts building inside you allowing to breath the element of your magic in a 15 radius cone in front of you. A target must succeed on a Dexterity save of 15 or take 12 (3d6) of your element on a failed save, or half as much on a save one. This feature will cost you 4 Dragonslayer Magic points.

Your Dragonslayer's elemental magic flows through your body allowing you to cover yourself in it. As a bonus action you may surround yourself with the element you wield for 10 minutes or until you use a bonus action to release your magic. When surrounded with your element you gain a +1 Bonus to your AC and any unarmed strike done towards you will hurt the attacker by 7 (2d6) of magic elemental damage. This feature will cost you 4 Dragonslayer Magic points.

You may unleash your element into the ground causing it to boil with power around a 5 foot safe zone. The ground in a 20-foot radius centered you becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 3d6 elemental damage for every 5 feet it travels. The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area at the time the spell is cast must make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it. This Dragonslayer Ability requires 6 Dragonslayer Magic Points and lasts for 1 minute.

id-00001.name: Tool: Choose two from among one type of gaming set, one musical instrument, and thieves' tools

text.p: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.
You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
You gain one feat of your choice.
